description: MATRIX Switch with Dimmer and Backlight
exclusion:
MATRIX’ remove function is initiated by pressing once on the centre switch (I) (under the pushbutton cover). The LED’s in pushbutton 1 will start blinking.

Factory Reset

MATRIX can be factory reset by holding the centre switch (I) under the pushbutton cover, for at least 10 seconds. By following this procedure, all configuration parameters and the device network address will be reset back to the values they had when the device was manufactured.
inclusion: MATRIX’ add function is initiated by pressing once on the centre switch (I) (under the pushbutton cover). The LED’s in pushbutton 1 will start blinking. If MATRIX already belongs to a Z-Wave network, the remove process must be performed before adding it into a new network. Otherwise, the adding of the device will fail.
label: ZDB5100
overview:
MATRIX type ZDB5100 is a multifunction switch that can be mounted in a modular wall-box, with built-in light dimmer and four configurable pushbuttons with RGB indicators.

The built-in light dimmer is per default attached to pushbutton 1. This attachment can be configured, thus it can be configured to not be controlled by any the four pushbuttons, so it can be independent of the local operation and thereby only be controllable from the Z-Wave network.

Furthermore, the pushbuttons can be configured to work together in pairs; thereby it can be possible to have one pushbutton to dim the light up, and another pushbutton to dim the light down.

The four RGB indicators, one for each pushbutton, can be used for different purposes, for example as orientation light, status light, different kind of indications, etc. The colour of the light and the control of it is fully controllable from the Z-Wave network.

MATRIX is also working as a repeater for the Z-Wave network and therefore expands the Z-Wave network coverage.
usage: Note that by default, polling of the binary switch returns the state of the the LED, and not the state of the switch. To change this, you must change parameters 19, 27, 35 and 43 to the value 2 (“As if pushbutton activated”).

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: Operating pushbutton(s) for dimmer
parameters.description: This parameter specifies which pushbutton(s) that controls the built-in dimmer.
parameters.overview:
The parameter is a bitmask, so each of the values can be added up in order to have several pushbuttons to operate the dimmer.

0 No local operation of the dimmer.
1 Pushbutton 1 controls the dimmer. (Default)
2 Pushbutton 2 controls the dimmer.
4 Pushbutton 3 controls the dimmer.
8 Pushbutton 4 controls the dimmer.

parameters.label: Duration of dimming
parameters.description: Specifies the duration of a full regulation of the light from 0% to 100%
parameters.overview:
A regulation of the light with 1% will take 1/100 of the specified duration. This is used when a pushbutton is held-down for controlling the dimming, and when the dimming is fulfilled from other Z-Wave devices when specifying factory default duration.

Value Description

0 Immediately
1 - 127 Duration in seconds. (Default is 5 seconds)
128 - 255 Duration in minutes (minus 127) from 1 – 128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute.

parameters.label: Duration of on/off.
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the duration when turning the light on or off.
parameters.overview:
0 Immediately. (Default).
1 - 127 Time in seconds. 
128 - 255 Time in minutes (minus 127) from 1 – 128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute

parameters.label: Dimmer mode.
parameters.description: The dimmer can work in different modes.

parameters.label: Dimmer minimum level.
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 0%.

parameters.label: Dimmer maximum level.
parameters.description: This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 99%

parameters.label: Central Scene notifications
parameters.description: This parameter can be used for disabling Central Scene notifications.

parameters.label: Double-activation functionality
parameters.description: Specifies the reaction when double-activating the pushbuttons

parameters.label: Enhanced LED control
parameters.description: Enabling the enhanced LED control
parameters.overview: This parameter can be used for enabling the enhanced LED control. See document about MATRIX enhanced LED control.

parameters.label: Pushbutton debounce timer
parameters.description: Pushbutton input debounce time in 0.01 seconds resolution.
parameters.overview: 1 – 2.55 seconds. Default is 5, which equals to a debounce-filter on 50 milliseconds (0.05 seconds).

parameters.label: Pushbutton press threshold time
parameters.description: Time that a button must be activated before it is detected as pressed
parameters.overview:
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must be activated before it is detected as pressed. Resolution is in 0.01 seconds.

1 – 2.55 seconds. Default is 20, which equals to 200 milliseconds (0.2 seconds).

parameters.label: Pushbutton held threshold time.
parameters.description: Time that a button must be activated before it is accepted as “held-down".
parameters.overview:
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must have been activated before it is accepted as “held-down”. Resolution is

0.01 seconds.

1 – 2.55 seconds. Default is 50, which equals to 500 milliseconds (0,5 seconds).

parameters.label: Global brightness control
parameters.description: Global brightness control
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies a common brightness for each of the three base colors for all four pushbutton indicators.

Byte 1 Red brightness
0-255 Brightness level for the red color in the 4 indicator groups. (Default is 255)
Byte 2  Green brightness
0-255

Brightness level for the green color in the 4 indicator groups. (Default is 255)
Byte 3  Green brightness
0-255 Brightness level for the blue color in the 4 indicator groups. (Default is 255)
Byte 4 Not used
0 Not used – must be set to 0.

parameters.label: Associations groups
parameters.description: Associations groups
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies if commands are transmitted as a secure message for each of the association groups.

This parameter is only used when the device is included in security mode (either S0 or S2).

Value Description
0 All messages in all groups are sent as insecure.
1 Messages in association group 2 are sent as secure.
2 Messages in association group 3 are sent as secure.
4 Messages in association group 4 are sent as secure.
8 Messages in association group 5 are sent as secure.
16 Messages in association group 6 are sent as secure.
32 Messages in association group 7 are sent as secure.
64 Messages in association group 8 are sent as secure.
128 Messages in association group 9 are sent as secure.
256 Messages in association group 10 are sent as secure.
512 Messages in association group 11 are sent as secure.
1024 Messages in association group 12 are sent as secure.
2048 Messages in association group 13 are sent as secure.
4096 Messages in association group 14 are sent as secure.
8191 Messages in all association groups are sent as secure. (Default)

parameters.label: Pushbutton 1 functionality
parameters.description: Pushbutton 1 functionality

options.label: Always turn off or dim down
Always turn on or dim up

parameters.label: Timer value for pushbutton 1
parameters.description: Timer value for pushbutton 1
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the time used in previous configuration parameter. This parameter is only applicable if previous parameter has value 1 or 2.

Value Description
0-43200 Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes.

parameters.label: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 1
parameters.description: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 1
parameters.overview:
Byte 1 Enable / Disable
0

Disabled – A single activation of the pushbutton will not send commands to devices in association group 4.
1

Enabled – A single activation will send commands to devices in association group 4. Devices will receive commands with the values set in Byte 2 and 3 (Default).
Byte 2 Upper switch value

0 - 99, 255

When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 255)
Byte 3 Lower switch value
0 - 99

hen single pressing the pushbutton for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4. (Default = 0)
Byte 4 Not used
0 must be set to 0.

parameters.label: Binary Switch Set support for pushbutton 1
parameters.description: Binary Switch Set support for pushbutton 1
parameters.overview: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.

parameters.label: Pushbutton 1 LED indication
parameters.description: This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled.

options.label: Internal LED control is disabled, only external.
LED follows the switch inverse status

parameters.label: Colour commands for pushbutton 1 LED indication
ON indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
parameters.description: ON indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when ON status is indicated. (Default is the ON-state indicated by a 50% blue colour).

Byte 1 Colour saturation, red.

0-255

Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 2 Colour saturation, green.

0 – 255

Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 0)
Byte 3 Colour saturation, blue
0 - 255

Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 127)
Byte 4 Led Control.
0 - 255

LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)

parameters.label: OFF indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
parameters.description: OFF indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
parameters.overview:
This parameter specifies the saturation levels for the red, green and blue LEDs, when OFF status is indicated. (Default is the OFF-state indicated as a low white light on 5%).

Byte 1 Colour saturation, red.
0 - 255 Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs. (Default is 47).
Byte 2 Colour saturation, green. 
0 – 255  Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs. (Default is 47) 
Byte 3 Colour saturation, blue. 
0 - 255 Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs. (Default is 47)
Byte 4 LED control.
0 - 255  LED indicator control; see the application note about this parameter. (Default is 0)

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.description: Sends Device Reset notifications, and Central Scene notifications.

associations.label: Basic Report, Pushbutton 1
associations.overview: Nodes in this group also receive Basic Report with the actual state of pushbutton 1. It can be used by other MATRIX devices to update their internal pushbutton states. Normally the state is reported by the controlled device, but in cases where this is not possible, the MATRIX devices can get synchronised by reporting to each other.

associations.label: Binary Switch Report, Pushbutton 1
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receive Binary Switch Set commands when pushbutton 1 is operated. It can be used for controlling other Z-Wave devices, e.g. a relay module.

associations.label: Multi-Level Report, Pushbutton 1
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receive Multi-Level Switch Set / Multi-Level Switch Start Level Change / Multi-Level Switch Stop Level Change when pushbutton 1 is operated. It can, as an example, be used for controlling light dimmers.

associations.label: Basic Report, Pushbutton 2
associations.overview: Nodes in this group also receives Basic Report with the actual state of pushbutton 2. It can be used by other MATRIX devices to update their internal pushbutton states. Normally the state is reported by the controlled device, but in cases where this is not possible, the MATRIX devices can get synchronised by reporting to each other.

associations.label: Binary Switch Report, Pushbutton 2
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receives Binary Switch Set commands when pushbutton 2 is operated. It can be used for controlling other Z-Wave devices, e.g. a relay module.

associations.label: Multi-Level Report, Pushbutton 2
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receives Multi-Level Switch Set / Multi-Level Switch Start Level Change / Multi-Level Switch Stop Level Change when pushbutton 2 is operated. It can, as an example, be used for controlling light dimmers.

associations.label: Basic Report, Pushbutton 3
associations.overview: Nodes in this group also receives Basic Report with the actual state of pushbutton 3. It can be used by other MATRIX devices to update their internal pushbutton states. Normally the state is reported by the controlled device, but in cases where this is not possible, the MATRIX devices can get synchronised by reporting to each other.

associations.label: Binary Switch Report, Pushbutton 3
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receives Binary Switch Set commands when pushbutton 3 is operated. It can be used for controlling other Z-Wave devices, e.g. a relay module.

associations.label: Multi-Level Report, Pushbutton 3
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receives Multi-Level Switch Set / Multi-Level Switch Start Level Change / Multi-Level Switch Stop Level Change when pushbutton 3 is operated. It can, as an example, be used for controlling light dimmers.

associations.label: Basic Report, Pushbutton 4
associations.overview: Nodes in this group also receives Basic Report with the actual state of pushbutton 4. It can be used by other MATRIX devices to update their internal pushbutton states. Normally the state is reported by the controlled device, but in cases where this is not possible, the MATRIX devices can get synchronised by reporting to each other.

associations.label: Binary Switch Report, Pushbutton 4
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receives Binary Switch Set commands when pushbutton 4 is operated. It can be used for controlling other Z-Wave devices, e.g. a relay module.

associations.label: Multi-Level Report, Pushbutton 4
associations.overview: Nodes in this group receives Multi-Level Switch Set / Multi-Level Switch Start Level Change / Multi-Level Switch Stop Level Change when pushbutton 4 is operated. It can, as an example, be used for controlling light dimmers.

associations.label: Dimmer Basic Report
associations.overview: Sends Basic Report with information about the actual level for the dimmer. This report is used by other MATRIX devices that are used for controlling this dimmer.
